intro: Memecylon hylophilum, commonly known as the hill memecylon, is a tropical evergreen shrub or small tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its opposite, elliptical leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by small, fleshy berries. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in primary forests. Its botanical features make it an important component of the understory vegetation in tropical ecosystems.
